soccer.common

Class Packet

  • java.lang.Object
    • soccer.common.Packet

  • public class Packet
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines the specialized UDP soccer packet between server and client. Constructors have been added as the project functionality was being enhanced.
    Author:
    Yu Zhang Vadim Kyrylov (since 2006)

      • packetType

        public char packetType
        Describes the type of packet. This is used to determine the expected data content.

      • data

        public Data data
        The actual data content in the packet.

      • address

        public java.net.InetAddress address
        UDP packet address in real mode: the receipient's address if the packet is sent; the sender's address if the packet is received.

      • port

        public int port
        UDP packet port number in real mode the receipient's port number if the packet is sent; the sender's port number if the packet is received.

      • senderIDdebug

        public int senderIDdebug
        Packet sender ID in the debug mode; not used by the receiver in the real mode. Coding conventions: 0 the server -1..-11 players in left team 1..11 players in right team 100..110 viewer clients

      • Packet

        public Packet(char type,
      Data data)
        Constructs a packet for a particular packet type to be sent over a UDP socket. The network address is set to localhost, and port number is set to 7777.
        Parameters:
        type - the packet type
        data - the data to hold

      • Packet

        public Packet(char type,
      Data data,
      java.net.InetAddress address,
      int port)
        Constructs a packet for a particular packet type to be sent over a UDP socket.
        Parameters:
        type - the packet type
        data - the object which actually holds the data
        address - the UDP packet's destination
        port - the port number of the receiving application

    • Method Detail

      • readPacket

        public final void readPacket(java.lang.String s)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        ReadPacket will try to get packet information from a string. It checks the first key word to see which packet it is and proceeds to read the Data content. It uses StringTokenizer to parse the data stored in the string. Once it finds out the type of the packet(data), it initializes a related data object(among ConnectData, InitData, SeeData, RefereeData, DriveData, KickData, and ViewData), and passes the rest of the StringTokenizer to its Data object for further parsing. After it's done, the newly created Data object will be populated by the parsed data.
        Parameters:
        s - the input string which contains data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown if things go really bad like wrong data format

      • writePacket

        public final java.lang.String writePacket()
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        writePacket will put a packet name, related data to a string. This method first creates a StringBuffer, puts in general header information. Then it checks packet(data) type to use related data object's writeData(StringBuffer) method to fill the data to the StringBuffer. Finally, it appends the close token to the StringBuffer, converts the StringBuffer to String and return the String. The returned String is then sent by class Transceiver over UDP.
        Returns:
        the String contains the encoded packet data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        Data.writeData(StringBuffer)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Convert Packet object to String for debug print
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
